author: abcoathup
content: Is there a writeup anywhere of the benefits to Solidity and the app layer of EOF?  I don't (yet) understand (but want to).

author: gcolvin
content:
> allow invalid EOF initcode in txs
This means that the VM cannot assume that the initcode is valid when run, like it can for other EOF code.  If we really, really don't want to validate initcode then it shouldn't be EOF code at all.

author: lightclient
content: it still validates the EOF, it just charges the user

author: lightclient
content: basically don't tie the _validity_ of a transaction to the _validity_ of initcode -- if the initcode is invalid, charge the user the intrinsic cost of the tx and update their nonce
